definitions.definition: To stake or pledge upon the outcome of an event; to wager .
examples: I('ll) bet I can run faster than you.
I bet you dinner at the Ritz that you can't run faster than me.
I bet (ted) her £5 it wouldn't rain all week.

definitions.definition: To be sure of something; to be able to count on something.
examples: Fancy going for a drink after work? / You bet I do!

definitions.definition: To place money into the pot in order to require others do the same, usually only used for the first person to place money in the pot on each round.

main_definition: ( transitive , ditransitive ) To stake or pledge upon the outcome of an event; to wager .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To be sure of something; to be able to count on something.
( poker ) To place money into the pot in order to require others do the same, usually only used for the first person to place money in the pot on each round.
